author: LeeHolmes
body:
This used to work on PowerShell v4
## Steps to reproduce

Register-ScheduledJob -Trigger (New-ScheduledTaskTrigger -AtLogOn) -FilePath c:\windows\system32\calc.exe
## Expected behavior

A scheduled job to be created
## Actual behavior
```
Register-ScheduledJob : Cannot bind parameter 'Trigger'. Cannot convert the "MSFT_TaskLogonTrigger" value of type
"Microsoft.Management.Infrastructure.CimInstance#Root/Microsoft/Windows/TaskScheduler/MSFT_TaskLogonTrigger" to type "Microsoft.PowerShell.ScheduledJob.ScheduledJobTrigger".
At line:1 char:32
- ... ter-ScheduledJob -Trigger (New-ScheduledTaskTrigger -AtLogOn) -FilePa ...
-                               ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  - CategoryInfo          : InvalidArgument: (:) [Register-ScheduledJob], ParameterBindingException
  - FullyQualifiedErrorId : CannotConvertArgumentNoMessage,Microsoft.PowerShell.ScheduledJob.RegisterScheduledJobCommand
```

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body:
Currently `PSScheduledJob` doesn't import on `6.0.0-beta.1`. /cc @adityapatwardhan 

```
C:\windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\Modules> ipmo .\PSScheduledJob
ipmo : The following error occurred while loading the extended type data file:
, C:\windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\Modules\PSScheduledJob\PSScheduledJob.types.ps1xml(18) : Error in type
"Microsoft.Management.Infrastructure.CimInstance": The "Type" node must have "Members", "TypeConverters", or
"TypeAdapters".
, C:\windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\Modules\PSScheduledJob\PSScheduledJob.types.ps1xml(21) : Error: Unable to
find type [Microsoft.PowerShell.ScheduledJob.JobTriggerToCimInstanceConverter, Microsoft.PowerShell.ScheduledJob,
Version=3.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35].
At line:1 char:1
+ ipmo .\PSScheduledJob
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [Import-Module], RuntimeException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : FormatXmlUpdateException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ImportModuleCommand
```

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body: However, it looks like the original report is from PS 5.1 where this is also broken. We should take a look at that as well /cc @SteveL-MSFT
